intro: Briseis triquetra, commonly known as the three-angled briseis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the temperate regions of the southern hemisphere, particularly in Australia. The plant is characterized by its triangular stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a distinctive three-lobed shape. Briseis triquetra is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to full sun conditions.
